Regardless of the current behavior; this PR, as is, introduces a worse bug: namely that existing graphs will crash in the new version of the C++ runtime. That's against TF's backwards compatibility guarantees. You are welcome to add a deprecation warning if you strongly believe this argument to be a bug -- we will review it. There's even a decorator that allows deprecating function arguments in TF.

body:
Regardless of the current behavior; this PR, as is, introduces a worse bug:
namely that existing graphs will crash in the new version of the C++
runtime.  That's against TF's backwards compatibility guarantees.

You are welcome to add a deprecation warning if you strongly believe this
argument to be a bug -- we will review it.  There's even a decorator that
allows deprecating function arguments in TF.
